pageContext.description: A cast copper alloy socketed leaf-shaped spearhead, dating from the middle to late Bronze Age (c. 1400-800 BC). The spearhead is incomplete, missing its tip; the socket survives and has some damage to its edge, as do the blades of the spearhead, but otherwise it is in good condition with a dark green patina. The socket neck has two sub-circular holes for securing the spearhead to the shaft, by cord or possibly rivets. The socket tapers throughout the length of the spearhead producing a rounded midrib that extends to the (broken) tip.
pageContext.notes: Another (incomplete) spearhead of the same date was found at the opposite end of the field; BERK-4F1825.
